content:
I do all the time. What you're describing is a bit like saying "If I didn't have to, I would not see or hear anything at all". It's likely because of the emotional relationship to certain beliefs that you have that cause the aversion to thought in the first place. 

I write or speak out loud to myself fairly frequently as a means of seeing what I think about something. You don't actually know exactly what your brain currently knows or wants to do unless you express it, so whether you journal or do a mini-podcast to yourself it is just "thinking".
